problem: Evaluate $\log_3 27\sqrt3$. Express your answer as an improper fraction.
model_solution:
## Step 1: Use the property of logarithms that allows us to bring the square root down into the logarithm.
$\log_3 27\sqrt3 = \log_3 (27 \cdot \sqrt3) = \log_3 (27) + \log_3 (\sqrt3)$
## Step 2: Use the definition of logarithms to rewrite each part of the expression.
$\log_3 27 + \log_3 \sqrt3 = \log_3 (3^3) + \log_3 (3^{1/2})$

Final Answer.

## Step 2: Use the definition of logarithms to rewrite each part of the expression.
